pull_requests.title: doc: update links in ci.yml
pull_requests.body: Updated three outdated GitHub links to avoid redirects.

| ACK | [Sjors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31736#issuecomment-2618549591) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
I'm interpreting the lint failure to be related to Cirrus CI itself.

I can reproduce the redirects in ece55afa1da973687877b23bc43d9ed354ede3bf. Can you rename the commit to something like `doc: update links in ci.yml`? (as @fanquake did for the PR title)

The CI failure went away.

pull_requests.title: Fix compilation errors in blockchain.cpp related to serialization, UTXO dumping, and path conversion
pull_requests.body:
issue: #31373

updated path conversion logic to handle std::string to fs::path, and addressing undeclared identifiers such as DumpUTXOSet.

<sub>Debug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/36165560973</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>
